question_text: Which of the following issues may prevent a successful drive cloning operation? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Source drive uses more space than the target drive’s capacity
Cloning software does not support the drive interface (e.g., NVMe)
Source drive is in hibernation mode during cloning
correct_answer: Source drive uses more space than the target drive’s capacity
Cloning software does not support the drive interface (e.g., NVMe)
Source drive is in hibernation mode during cloning
explanation: All listed factors can disrupt cloning: encryption blocks low-level access, hibernation locks files, size mismatch breaks transfers, and interface issues cause incompatibility.
